title: 6 Things to Do in San Francsico in March 2017
seo_title: Things to Do in San Francisco in March 2017
long_description:
A new month, a fresh list of people to see and places to go. And as the weather continues to warm up, the more things there will be to do. Here are the Stanford Court Hotel picks for what’s going on in San Francisco in March 2017.

 

Monet, The Early Years @ the Legion of Honor, through May 29

This is the first US exhibition dedicated to Monet’s early work. See how Monet came into his own, experimenting with different techniques before finding that internationally recognized style.

 

Google Next Conference @ the Moscone Center, March 8-10, 2017

The annual conference celebrating Google Cloud returns this year with 200+ sessions, numerous panels and hands-on training experience.

 

Hamilton @ Orpheum Theater, March 10-August 5, 2017

The highly-acclaimed Broadway hit makes it to the west coast for 5 months of hip-hop infused history lessons and beats you just can’t help but get down to.

 

St. Patrick’s Day Parade, March 11, 2017

Celebrate Ireland’s most popular holiday in the streets of downtown San Francisco. The yearly St. Patrick’s Day parade features bagpipes, Irish dancers, and tons of green.

 

Michael Carbonaro @ the Masonic, March 12, 2017

The Masonic welcomes America’s hottest magician Michael Carbonaro for a night filled with laughs and magic.

 

Rock ‘n’ Roll Half Marathon, March 26, 2017

The popular marathon series returns to the one city that can give it a run for its money. Run across the Golden Gate Bridge and jam out to SF locals Monophonics.

 

***

Like what you’re reading? Give us a like on Facebook.
